wikipedia_page.main: Captain Lewis Isaac Collins   (born 7 November 1894 – 1 June 1971) was a Scottish World War I flying ace credited with five aerial victories.

response: **Lewis Collins (RAF officer) (1894–1971), British World War I flying ace
* Lewis Collins (1946–2013), English film and theatre actor
* Lewis Collins (RAF officer) (1894–1971), British First World War flying ace

He went on to gain another victory on 28 May, and scored double victories on 30 May and 11 June 1918. Fifteen of his triumphs were over enemy fighters; he destroyed eight and drove seven down out of control. He also destroyed an enemy two-seater. Among his observer gunners were fellow aces Lewis Collins and William Miller.

Lewis Collins (1946–2013) was an English actor.
Lewis Collins may also refer to:
* Lewis Collins (RAF officer) (1894–1971), British World War I flying ace

Captain Lewis Collins, MC, credited with five aerial victories in 1918 as an observer in the Royal Flying Corps/Royal Air Force, was born in Dundee and originally enlisted as a sapper in the Fortress Engineers.Aces at The Aerodrome.
